intro: Jurinea perula-orientis, commonly known as the oriental sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Black Sea, where it thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant features silver-blue foliage and produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for coastal gardens and landscaping.
